title._content: ["Beechwood," Frank Arthur Vanderlip house, Scarborough, New York. (LOC)

description._content: Johnston, Frances Benjamin,, 1864-1952,, photographer. ["Beechwood," Frank Arthur Vanderlip house, Scarborough, New York. Pergola] [ca. 1912] 1 photograph : glass lantern slide, hand-colored ; 3.25 x 4 in. Notes: Site History. House Architecture: 18th century house expanded by Robert H. Robertson for Walter Webb from whom Frank Arthur Vanderlip purchased the house and 23 acres in 1906. William Welles Bosworth additions for Vanderlip. Landscape: William Welles Bosworth on 125 acres, and Narcissa Cox (Mrs. Frank Arthur) Vanderlip. Today: House and elements of the landscape design extant as private property; part of the Scarborough Historic District on the registery of National Historic Places. On slide (handwritten): "V" and "Vanderslip." Also, hollow orange circle. Photographed when Frances Benjamin Johnston and Mattie Edwards Hewitt worked together. Title, date, and subject information provided by Sam Watters, 2011. Forms part of: Garden and historic house lecture series in the Frances Benjamin Johnston Collection (Library of Congress). Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.16735 Call Number: LC-J717-X108- 8
